intro: Eleocharis capitata var. pseudoptera, commonly known as the slender spike rush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescence that is often clustered at the tip of the stem. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and pond edges, where it thrives in moist to saturated soil conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, and the plant produces minute, wind-dispersed seeds. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
